data.title: The Art Institute of California - Silicon Valley / Sunnyvale
data.meta_description: The Art Institute of California - Silicon Valley/Sunnyvale was under the Argosy University branch.  The school is permanently closed as of 07/12/2019.
data.text:
The Art Institute of California- Silicon Valley/Sunnyvale was under the Argosy University branch. The school is permanently closed as of 07/12/2019.

If you're having trouble getting your documentation with the above, please go here.

Address: 1120 Kifer Rd Sunnyvale, CA 94086

Phone: (408) 962-6400 or (866) 583-7961

Email: [email protected]

Website: new.artinstitutes.edu/silicon-valley

Founded: 2008

Enrollment: 765 (2011)

FAFSA School Code: 021799

President

John Andersen

MEDIA CONTACT

Contact: Devra Pransky, Senior Director of Communications, Phone: (412) 995.7685 (office); (412) 657.8413 (mobile); or [email protected]

ACCREDITATION

The Art Institute of California, Silicon Valley (Sunnyvale) is a campus of Argosy University. Argosy University is accredited by the Senior College and University Commission of the Western Association of Schools and Colleges (WASC) and is located at 985 Atlantic Avenue, Suite 100, Alameda, California, 94501. (Source) Ai California - Silicon Valley/Sunnyvale was accredited by ACICS originally, and then WASC once the Art Institute California campuses merged under the Argosy system.

The Art Institute of California - Silicon Valley (Sunnyvale) was founded in 2008 as a branch of California Design College. Four years later, the school combined with eight other California campuses of The Art Institutes to create a single college of art and design within the Argosy University system. The school occupies approximately 53,000 square feet of classroom, computer lab, library, and office space.
